6
7// Thread.cpp : Defines the Thread class which represents a global EGL thread.
8
9#include "libANGLE/Thread.h"
10
11#include "libANGLE/Context.h"
12#include "libANGLE/Debug.h"
13#include "libANGLE/Error.h"
14
15namespace angle
16{
17bool gUseAndroidOpenGLTlsSlot;
18} // namespace angle
19
20namespace egl
21{
22
23Thread::Thread()
24 : mLabel(nullptr),
25 mError(EGL_SUCCESS),
26 mAPI(EGL_OPENGL_ES_API),
27 mContext(static_cast<gl::Context *>(EGL_NO_CONTEXT))
28{}
29
30void Thread::setLabel(EGLLabelKHR label)
31{
32 mLabel = label;
33}
34
35EGLLabelKHR Thread::getLabel() const
36{
37 return mLabel;
38}
39
40void Thread::setSuccess()
41{
42 mError = EGL_SUCCESS;
43}
44
45void Thread::setError(const Error &error,
46 const Debug *debug,
47 const char *command,
48 const LabeledObject *object)
49{
50 ASSERT(debug != nullptr);
51
52 mError = error.getCode();
53 if (error.isError() && !error.getMessage().empty())
54 {
55 debug->insertMessage(error.getCode(), command, ErrorCodeToMessageType(error.getCode()),
56 getLabel(), object ? object->getLabel() : nullptr, error.getMessage());
57 }
58}
59
60EGLint Thread::getError() const
61{
62 return mError;
63}
64
65void Thread::setAPI(EGLenum api)
66{
67 mAPI = api;
68}
69
70EGLenum Thread::getAPI() const
71{
72 return mAPI;
73}
74
75void Thread::setCurrent(gl::Context *context)
76{
77 mContext = context;
78}
79
80Surface *Thread::getCurrentDrawSurface() const
81{
82 if (mContext)
83 {
84 return mContext->getCurrentDrawSurface();
85 }
86 return nullptr;
87}
88
89Surface *Thread::getCurrentReadSurface() const
90{
91 if (mContext)
92 {
93 return mContext->getCurrentReadSurface();
94 }
95 return nullptr;
96}
97
98gl::Context *Thread::getContext() const
99{
100 return mContext;
101}
102
103Display *Thread::getDisplay() const
104{
105 if (mContext)
106 {
107 return mContext->getDisplay();
108 }
109 return nullptr;
110}
111} // namespace egl
112
